its fun. The game is simple. Asymmetrical horror online co op game. The thing is you need a good team, or a good friend to play with. You will die alot, if you dont have good cooperation. Overall i love it, have a great time playing and wasting hours with my friend.

a constant reminder of the best and worst part of group projects.

I still play this game, mainly with my friends, but this thing is so broken that I just can't recommend it.

MMR is painfully terrible
Killers got worse overtime
Much more boring than it once was for casual play.

It's only worth it if you've got 4 or more other consistent people to play KYF's (custom lobbies) with, and even then you're severely limited by DLC's which while most you can get via playing the game (which takes far too long considering how boring it is) it get's old quickly when you're being killed off first for a bubba standing on your face while you slowly die off.

Also there's considerably more cheating than a year or two ago.

i was a ps4 player not long ago and i loved this game so much. but as soon as i switched to pc the game went dry but i am now returning to the game. [the game is so much funner with friends.]  i still have much love for this game hopefully they start listening to the community more :]
It's a fun game, especially when playing with others. Load times can suck sometimes.
This game sucks. Nobody actually has fun playing this, but we still play it.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/381210/Dead_by_Daylight/
really good game and it really spooks me

made me hit a high note from screaming
10/10 recommend

- Terrible balance
- Embarrassing level of optimisation, FPS issues in 2022 even with low graphic settings... wtf
- Matchmaking system widens the range of players too much, resulting in bad matchups, especially if you're practicing a new killer
- No shits given about toxicity and no confirmation that toxic players get punished in any form
- Cheaters, blatant or subtle, have not been hindered in any significantly obvious manner by BVHR's anti-cheat system. Subtle cheaters are the most damaging type of cheater, they cause doubt for the killer and annoyance when they know they are facing subtle hacks
- Hitboxes and lag are a fucking joke
- No practice mode to train any new killer one might be interested in becoming better at, leading to one having to get most likely shit on in matches with said new killer
- Environmental collisions are badly designed, or no good playtesting has been conducted for them. No reason to make a player focus on random little obstructions across a surface when looping, so why insert that in there? No practice mode as well to get a better feel of some collisions, which is very important in matches as it can be the difference between a hit and a lack of one

This is not an easy game to pick up and play, as its multiplayer only.

You're going to find difficulty when playing both survivor and killer, but especially as survivor.
You can get the hang of it yourself if you're observant, but you're more than likely gonna need to watch a guide, maybe two on how to play decently so that you can rack some wins and fun times when playing alone. Perks are going to be the biggest thing to learn in the game, as some of them can really tilt the game in the favor of either parties, so I suggest getting to know which ones do and dont help you.

You dont 'need' perks, it is possible to win w/o them, but you're putting yourself at a pretty big disadvantage if you dont use them. You're also never gonna know what perks people have until the end of teh game, so again, get to know your perks overtime.

It is a lot more fun to play private sessions with friends, if you have any. If you dont, its not hard to make on forums, discord servers, or wherever else has a community for DBD.

I personally love the game, and if you like somewhat-intense chaser strategy, you'll like this game too.
